result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Alben Rice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad Alben Rice is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chad Alben Rice was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

9:31 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Chad Alben Rice in court. Attorney Rebecca Adams in court for Chad Alben Rice.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM424 and 22CT82 and 22TR917. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - OWI 2 in 22CT82 and GUILTY to Ct 2 - Bail Jump in 22CM424. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - OWI 2nd in 22CT82 and GUILTY to Ct 2 in 22CM424. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 22CT82 and Ct 1 in 22CM424 and 22TR917.  Sentencing recommendations.
Crt orders 22CT82 - Count 1:
- $1429.00 Inclusive of costs 
- 10 days in St. Croix County Jail. 2 days credit with good time. Def may serve two weekends. Def to report on Friday, 12/9 by 5:00 pm and released the following Monday morning and report back Friday, 12/16 until sentence is served. 
- AODA and driver safety plan 
- 12 month driver license revocation 
- 12 month Ignition Interlock 

22CM424, Count 2: 
S/W 1 year probation with conditions: 
- $243 in court costs
- 200 in DNA surcharge
- DNA sample
- AODA and complete all recommendations
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol. 
-  Absolute Sobriety
- Sobriety to be monitored by random and regular testing by DOC agent
- Complete any programming deemed appropriate by COMPASS and as requested by agent. 

Defendant to pay through the clerk of court office $300/mo, commencing on 12/1.
